docs.snippet: The New York World's Fair 1939 will be the most truly international exposition ever held, Grover A. Whalen, president of the fair corporation, declared yesterday in announcing that sixty, nations already had taken steps to participate. Forty-six...
docs.lead_paragraph: The New York World's Fair 1939 will be the most truly international exposition ever held, Grover A. Whalen, president of the fair corporation, declared yesterday in announcing that sixty, nations already had taken steps to participate. Forty-six countries and the League of Nations have officially accepted President Roosevelt's invitation and the others have reserved space and are due to sign by the end of the year.

headline.main: 60 NATIONS ACCEPT WORLD'S FAIR BIDS; League Is Included in Those Signing Contracts or Asking for Space Reservations

docs.snippet: President Roosevelt and Secretary of State Cordell Hull today led the nation in tribute to Frank B. Kellogg, former Secretary of State and coauthor of the pact to outlaw war, who died yesterday at the age of 81. Secretary Hull designated a personal...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Roosevelt and Secretary of State Cordell Hull today led the nation in tribute to Frank B. Kellogg, former Secretary of State and coauthor of the pact to outlaw war, who died yesterday at the age of 81. Secretary Hull designated a personal representative to attend the funeral in St. Paul tomorrow in the Person of William Donovan, American Minister-designate to Uruguay.

headline.main: KELLOGG TRIBUTE PAID BY PRESIDENT; Former Secretary of State's Efforts to Promote Peace Praised by Roosevelt HULL EXPRESSES REGRET Foreign Leaders Also Honor Diplomat, Whose Funeral Will Be Held Today Message to Widow Work Praised by Cecil Mourned in Canada Chilean Press Pays Tribute Honored for Diplomacy Funeral Services Today

docs.snippet: In funeral services held in the Church of St. John the Evangelist the people of Minnesota paid tribute today to Frank Billings Kellogg, former Secretary of State and author of the pact outlawing war.

headline.main: SERVICE IN ST. PAUL HELD FOR KELLOGG; Home State Pays Tribute to Author of Anti-War Pact as 300 Attend

docs.snippet: The United States Chamber of Commerce reported today that trade with Latin-American countries had increased substantially during the first nine months of 1937, compared with the corresponding period of last year.
